verbose_text: After the death of a Swiss bat biologist in Finland in 1985 and subsequent characterisation of the causative agent, it became evident that bat rabies in Europe at the time was caused by two different lyssaviruses, EBLV-1 and 2 [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
evidence: bat rabies in Europe at the time was caused by two different lyssaviruses, EBLV-1 and 2
